Legal_Issue: Whether the trademark 'ENGINEERING EXCELLENCE IS OUR HERITAGE' is deceptively misdescriptive or clearly descriptive under Section 12(1)(b) of the Trade-marks Act and whether it is distinctive under Section 2
Procedural_Stage: Appeal hearing with new evidence considered
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant employs engineers globally but not in Canada; no Canadian engineers involved despite use of 'engineering' in mark
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate distinctiveness and non-descriptiveness
Credibility_Factor: Misuse of term 'engineering' without Canadian professional involvement affects credibility of claim
Legal_Rule: Section 12(1)(b): Prohibits registration of clearly descriptive or deceptively misdescriptive marks; Section 2: Mark must be distinctive
Standard_of_Review: Statutory interpretation and application of Trade-marks Act provisions
Procedural_Issue: Consideration of new evidence during appeal
Grounds_for_Claim: Opposition based on unauthorized use of 'engineering', suggesting professional affiliation
Outcome_on_Merits: Trademark found clearly descriptive and lacking distinctiveness
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Process followed proper procedures with opportunity to present evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Employment of engineers outside Canada; absence of licensed Canadian engineers
Applicant_Challenge: Failure to prove distinctiveness and avoidance of descriptiveness
Defendant_Response: Not applicable – opposition raised by third party (Canadian Council of Professional Engineers)
Evidence_Type: Factual evidence regarding employment practices and professional licensing
Decision_Authority: Hearing Officer under the Trade-marks Act
Authority: Canadian Intellectual Property Office (CIPO) – Hearing Officer
Claimant_Status: Canadian Council of Professional Engineers as opponent
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 12(1)(b), Section 2 of the Trade-marks Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Deceptively misdescriptive, clearly descriptive, lack of distinctiveness
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Trademark registration application withdrawn or rejected
